metatags.og:title: This virtual image of the Australian bushfires was created using NASA data -- it's not a satellite photo
metatags.og:description: An image has been shared thousands of times in multiple posts on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram, alongside a claim that it is a photograph of the bushfires in Australia taken from space by a NASA satellite. The photo has been circulated in a misleading context; a Brisbane-based photographer said he created the image digitally using NASA’s data of the Australian bushfires.
metatags.twitter:creator: @afpfactuel

metatags.og:title: Top maps and charts that explain the terrifying 2019-20 Australian bushfires - Geoawesomeness
metatags.og:description: Australia battles bushfires every year, but the current fire season is decisively one of the worst. The wildfires that originated in the state of New South Wales in September 2019 have rapidly spread throughout the continent, swallowing more than 14.7 million acres across six states till date. Here are some maps and charts that will […]
